definition: Pirate Party, political movement whose main goal is to reform copyright law in line with the Internet era

sentences.english: Instead, they watch pirated DVDs or surf the Web.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之，他們看盜版光碟或者在網上衝浪。

sentences.english: The decision could reduce the market for counterfeit and pirated products in China.
sentences.chinese: 這一裁決有可能削弱中國的假冒產品和盜版產品市場。

sentences.english: Don't worry about piracy for this song.
sentences.chinese: 不要擔心這首曲子被盜版。

sentences.english: China has promised repeatedly to take tougher measures to curb piracy.
sentences.chinese: 中國已一再承諾，會採取更強硬的措施來遏止盜版。

sentences.english: The struggle against online piracy is beginning to feel the same way.
sentences.chinese: 打擊網絡盜版的過程與此也開始有了相似之處。

sentences.english: Such offerings may also succeed in reducing the demand for pirated music.
sentences.chinese: 這種服務的提供也可以使盜版音樂需求下降。

sentences.english: Coupled with the rapid development of information technology, piracy emergences everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 信息業的高速發展，隨之而來的是盜版的肆意氾濫。

sentences.english: That way, only the über-nerds and the cash-poor/time-rich classes will bother to copy instead of buy.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，只有缺錢時間又多的人才會購買盜版。

sentences.english: If you did that, you’d kill piracy. Probably.
sentences.chinese: 如果你這麼幹，你也許就可以杜絕盜版了。

sentences.english: A book salesman cheats students, because his books are piracy.
sentences.chinese: 一個賣書人欺騙學生去買他的盜版書。

sentences.english: And it is just part of a blizzard of anti-piracy activity.
sentences.chinese: 銷量上升也只是反盜版運動的一部分。

sentences.english: The entertainment industry is growing increasingly desperate in its attempts to prevent online piracy.
sentences.chinese: 目前，娛樂產業的反盜版舉措越來越無力。

sentences.english: From a vendor? Then, it must be a pirate copy.
sentences.chinese: 從一個小販那裏？那麼，這一定是一張盜版碟了。

sentences.english: As for administration aspects, the administrative authorities at all levels were putting emphasis on strengthening anti-piracy work.
sentences.chinese: 在行政方面，各級行政機關非常注重加強反盜版工作。

sentences.english: Books are very cheap in China, even for non-bootleg stuff.
sentences.chinese: 即使非盜版，中國書價也非常便宜。

sentences.english: THE SWEDISH Pirate Party has been favoured to win at least one seat in the European parliament this week.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典盜版黨很可能在本週歐洲議會的選舉中獲勝。

definition: to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
paper/hard copy/printed (as opposed to electronically displayed)
brick and mortar business/physical (rather than online) retail store
network (computer, telecom)/Internet/Taiwanese term for 網絡|网络[wang3 luo4]
simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
